main event: Three intense lights in trail formation were reported over Miami, Florida on May 27, 1957.
interesting points: The lights were described as very close together, round in shape, and lasted for 2-3 seconds.
The lights disappeared below the horizon in the west.
A jet aircraft was reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
The case was initially classified as a possible meteor, but the report also considered the possibility of the lights being an aircraft.
The weather conditions were described as clear with high scattered visibility of 15 miles.
sighted object: three intense lights in trail formation
